fields.description:
Currently there are no direct links to Crucible project, hence Crucible tab always go to http://FISHEYE_URL/cru. Once we are in the Crucible application we lose context of current project and we cannot create links on a tabs back to Jira/Confluence/Fisheye.

Problem with losing current project context can occur in some other places (Confluence search, Crucible search, maybe some administration screens, etc)
fields.summary: Persisting project context in Crucible

fields.description:
Some errors & improvements needed in the 'Add Project' confirmation (screenshot attached).

* Please change JIRA to Issues, Confluence to WIki, and FishEye to Source.
* Should be WIki space successfully created, not successfully create Wiki space
* Please add 'Administer Project' as a link right below the page title, above the application success bars. I know that the link in the issues portion will do the same, but the user won't know that and will typically want to administer the project immediately after adding it.
fields.summary: Updates to Add Project Confirmation

fields.description:
Confluence currently uses a really old Prototype 1.4.pre version. Many of the functions used in the navbar are not supported by that version of prototype and therefore not compatible. Jira uses a later version, but is looking into getting rid of prototype completely. Our options:

* Decouple prototype from the combined JavaScript servlet (will require an update of the decorators and all themes)
* Change navigation bar to be compatible with older version of prototype. 
* Move to YUI (which is supposedly becoming the new standard across all our applications)

The task is to evaluate the different options and to implement a solution.
fields.summary: Make Navigation Bar JavaScript compatible with Confluence

fields.description:
Deleting a space associates with a project in Jira will still display that project  in the drop-down menu in Confluence and therefore render an invalid link. We have to handle the deletion better. Following are a few options we have to handle the problem:

* remove option to delete space when associated with a project
* when deleting a space send remote request to other applications to de-associate the space from the project
* link to JIRA project administration
* Display message and link to JIRA project administration
fields.summary: Handle deletion of spaces and repositories associates with projects

fields.description: In order to support third-party plugins that need applinks information, we need a client api jar that they can compile against.  This allows plugins to still depend on Java 1.4.
fields.summary: Applinks client api

fields.description:
Implement studio administration console

*  A single, simple administration console available via the JIRA administration screen (and linked from the Admin tab of the NavBar for admin users).
    * Contains controls for Studio-specific admin tasks, common admin tasks for the other applications (grouped functionally, not by application), and links to the Confluence and Fisheye admin screens for further tweaking.

Requirements and mock up can be found on:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HS/Studio+Administration+console
fields.summary: Implenting Studio Administration console
